title: Banshee's needs a buff, Maw and Scimitar need a nerf
body:
That whole "40 seconds of no damage from enemy champions" thing shows why the items barely ever purchased anymore unless you're playing against Singed. Maybe it doesn't need 70 MR, but that passive cooldown is ridiculous considering how easy it is to pop beforehand. Maybe make it an active, like a Sivir spellshield.

Maw and Scimitar both straight up just need a nerf. I know Maw is being looked at in the next patch or two, but 75 AD on a really strong counter to any champion that needs a debuff? Kind of unnecessary.

replies.body: Honestly if Banshee's passive was only on a timer without requiring the condition of not taking enemy damage it would greatly improve the item's consistency/efficiency. No need for a stat buff, just a straight-up functionality improvement.

It really doesn't need a stat buff. It used to be on a flat timer like that (and a long time ago it used to give mana and build of of catalyst). It was the go to defensive item on almost every champion, but it made you take a serious offensive hit for building defensively.

The funny thing about Banshees is that its recipe contains Spectres Cowl   which grants 150% health regen when hit and Crystalline Bracer that grants 50% health  regen but when Banshees is completed, you end up with 100% health regen while Spirit Visage has 150% health regen WITHOUT CRYSTALLINE BRACER OR REJUVENATION BEAD IN ITS RECIPE.

Just a small nitpick.

Why is it 'funny'?

Visage may give more hp regen than Banshee's, but Banshee's blocks a flat amount of damage or saves you from CC. Wouldn't it be okay to take the -50% hp regen hit for the sake of not taking upwards of 300-400 spell damage + crowd control tied to it?
Because, like simply said, the recipe doesn't make sense. Why should you be buying regen over regen if the total amount is less than what you payed for? For clarity sake at least.
Wait. How long has it done this? I've been buying Banshee's all season!
Years.
Wait why nerf maw? what's wrong with it? (genuinely curious)

well that's more of an issue with riot's balancing and not really the items.
same with devourer junglers being to steamroll thanks to their kit giving them the ability to abuse stuff like guinsoo and rageblade.

The problem is that Zhonyas has a terrible build path and a 1050 (!!!!) Gold cost just to merge the ingredient items. It's horribly gold inefficient and the stats largely don't warrant the cost either (let's be real, 1 AD is worth way more than 1 AP). Add to the fact that zhonyas is like ~85% gold efficient without active (compared to maw which iirc was actually 100% without the passive) and you just have an overpriced item.

Heck, even Riot said that they're considering [nerfs to maw/steraks, though they're aiming for patch 6.7](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4azb3u/were_considering_toning_down_hexdrinker_andor_maw/)

yeah zhonya's does have a terrible build path but I don't see how you can nerf maw without making it unusable.
unless you increase it's price in which case It wouldn't really change much
If they removed the lifegrip it'll be fine.

You mean the passive lifegrip, right?
You get 10% lifesteal and spellvamp temporarily when the shield pops until out of combat, but none otherwise.

Yea the entire lifegrip i meant, aside from that and maybe 10MR maw is a fine item.

Lifegrip on maw is a heavy issue because it gives AS+Lifesteal which assassins don't even care much about since they don't stay in combat to AA enough for it to matter much. However because it gives that AS+Lifesteal from lifegrip marksmen are picking it up QQ.

Riot really shouldn't have tried keeping lifegrip from rageblade OR they should have put lifegrip on a full offensive item instead of a defensive one like maw.

It was actually specifically reworked for marksmen, so marksmen picking it up isn't really an issue. The issue is just cost efficiency, that's it. It needs a small nerf to the gold cost and it'll be fine. It just feels far too easy to build given how strong it is when built.

And if they removed 10mr+lifegrip passive it would have any issues fixed.

It's gold cost does matter yes  but the lifegrip addition on a defensive item like it is just simply being abused by marksmen.

Lifegrip is only a problem because it has a theoretical 100% uptime since all you have to do is HIT something to keep the buff up. If it could actually run out and not stay on when Kalista has already reached full health it would be fine.

Lifegrip just needs to be removed so adcs don't synergize with it as well, cause assassins don't really want to stay around and AA things and try to lifesteal to survive in combat they tend to go in, get a target and try to get out the lifegrip passive only benefits adcs thus will be abused by them.

Although if they made lifegrip melee only, i wouldn't complain about that.

I'm pretty sure it was reworked into an AD caster/assassin item.
ADC reworks made some items more ADC-oriented, and some less ADC-oriented. Things like {{item:3078}} and {{item:3508}} became more ADC oriented, while {{item:3142}} and {{item:3156}} became more AD assassin oriented (you can see that from the arpen).

Zhonia is only good on the champions that can ult and use Zhonia like Fiddle or Morgana.

Zhonia's wont save you 1v1, doesnt allow actions, while Maw hardcounters AP champions like crazy, allows actions (aka kill back the AP champion) and has an extremely strong passive together with the shield (that also scales, unlike Zhonia's).

The main problem is that Zhonia is the ONLY non-support AP/AR item in the game midlaners can buy, on top of not being good with all AP champions.

It's amazing how doubling the cooldown on the spell block and make an item completely garbage.  1 spell every 20 seconds was super powerful and stopped a lot of CC like bindings, hooks, grabs etc that would have allowed the team to get a kill which would allow them to theoretically take more objectives being 5v4.  

Maw won't stop CC which could lead to the situation I described above.  That was the power of Banshees.  The stats are good but that spell block every 20 seconds was super strong.  Making it once every 40 seconds totally destroyed the item which is why the other items have risen up so much.  

Late game, especially with the long fucking death timers right now, Banshees could mean the difference between winning and losing the game.
It isn't only that the cooldown was increased... it was also that champion damage resets the cooldown... which forces you to stay out of fights for 40 seconds to get the shield back up...

haha yea.  Flash has been mandatory for every champ since I can remember.  Every so often Rito comes out and says they are looking at flash then go silent for another 12-14 months on it after doing nothing.  The only thing I ever remember them doing to flash was lowering the range it flashed you.  That was years ago.  I think it's safe to say that we will never have the option of choosing two summoner spells.  Flash will always be one of them so choose your one and only summoner spell wisely.

Over the lifetime of flash its range has been adjusted either 2 or 3 times, its cooldown has been adjusted at least twice if not more and its cast time (yes it used to have a .5 second cast time) has been changed to instant. Flash was much more obnoxious in the past, but yes ultimately still mandatory.

They would have to remove it from the game or completely nerf it so hard it wished it would be removed from the game for it to not be mandatory. Flash is too versatile and there is rarely a moment you would ever say to yourself "Damn I wish I took something besides Flash that game". Instant gapcloser and the ability to just go over walls makes Flash mandatory in itself since you can escape so many occasions by you having it up and your opponent not (also would make Purple Side substantially worse than Blue Side if it were removed since it would be DAMN near impossible to ever steal Baron unless you were a jungler with an inherent wall hopping gap closer, which is Shyvana).
Yea, basically. The only time flash isn't mandatory is when you're too low level to have it unlocked.
